title: Lice
description: Pam causes a lice outbreak but lets Meredith take the blame, Jim has a business meeting with Dr. J, and some coworkers try to get Darryl and Val back together.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: To me, the Sixers are a five seed tops.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think they're going to the conference finals.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Bynum, obvious monster and the three point shooting, don't even-... [Jim bites his lip]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I bit my lip at lunch today.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Sucks. Anyway, I just don't see it. The Knicks are tough.The Nets are tough.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, the Nets are super tough.  [Jim in pain from his lip]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Now I have this big bump in my lip that hurts. I hate it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: The Hawks are terrible. They're always terrible.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, you need to think about it before you come with the... [Jim bites his lip again and pounds on table]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whatever. It's not a big deal. You know I always tell my three year old, if this is the worst thing that's gonna happen...[Jim bites his lip again] You gotta be kidding me! Ok! Pam! That's it, I'm going home!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Good morning, Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, sorry, Pam. Yikes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim's been spending a few days a week in Philly and I'm not gonna lie, it's been challenging. Yesterday, things took a turn for the worse. I found out Cece has lice. So I was up all night disinfecting every sheet, towel, toy, item of clothing in the entire house. I'm exhausted. But don't tell Jim. He has a huge meeting today, under a lot of pressure and he's doing it all for the family.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I am meeting Dr. J today, otherwise known as Julius Irving, famed 76er and my own personal hero. But i have to be careful not to rub it in Pam's face because let's be honest, how would I feel if I was at home stuck with the kids while she was go carting with John Stamos.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [talking on phone] You sound tired. Everything ok?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great. Everything's great. Hey are you nervous about your big meeting?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uhh, a little bit. It's a lot of pressure, you know, but that's what I signed up for right?

quotes.speaker: Worker
quotes.text: Jim, limo's here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, you know what, I gotta hop off because my, uh, taxi is here to take me to the meeting.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, call me later!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good luck!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Love you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Love you too. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: How you doing?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Alright. I mean, it's what you want, so...

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: It's how it has to be.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I know, I know. It's just hard.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Me and Val were going nowhere and if I'm gonna be working in Philly, I'm gonna need my freedom. So, I convinced Val to breakup with me. Here's how you do it. You say, "What are you gonna do, breakup with me?" Like it's a joke, and then you gain a lot of weight.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'll never be sorry, not for a moment of it.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Me neither. Come here. [she hugs Darryl, and Darryl smiles behind her back]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey Meredith, I need your supplier requests today.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Jeez H. in the morning. Will you stop your nagging already? No wonder Jim left you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He didn't leave me. He just went part time. [Meredith scratches her head vigorously] Can you just fill out the form please?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm sure she's just confused. People scratch their heads when they're confused. Not always like an ape, the way Meredith just did, but it happens.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hurry up already.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [checking Meredith's head]  Trust me, I know what I'm doing. Between the foster homes and the orphanage, I had lice 22 times.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Holy wow, that's a big one. Alright, pencils down everyone, we got lice!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh God, Meredith, lice? Did you not sign a pledge to shower?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? Lice? Oh my god. Lock the doors, we are on full quarantine.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, relax. It's just lice. Maybe, possibly.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just lice Pam?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Of all of the vermin in God's great green kingdom, lice are the ones I detest the most. My first day of school, I had lice, and no one would play with me. For 15 years, they called me freak and four eyes and sci-fi nerd and girl puncher. All because I had lice when I was 7.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Make way, nope, inspect me.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, this is the cleanest scalp I've ever seen. You are all clear.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Should be. I use lice shampoo every morning. [Dwight starts spraying everyone with disinfectant]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Stop that!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Next!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [getting her head checked] Geez Meredith, you know, this is an office not one of your bean bag orgies.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Alright, let's give her a break. We don't know for sure this is Meredith's fault.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Pam, really? Come on.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, what do you want? I know who I am. Nobody's taken Meredith Palmer to the opera to meet the queen.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Lice. More lice. [Angela shrieks in disgust] Angela has lice.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ew! Oh.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [checking Stanley's head] Ooh yabber, lice!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [checking Pam's head] Yikers, lice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No! How? I'm so clean!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [checking Oscar's head] Oh yeah, big time lice.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I wash my hands at least six times a day. Toilet seat covers? Yes, thank you, even when I pee. Apparently, none of that is protection enough. Not when it comes to Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What are you wearing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's a Hazmat suit. That stands for hazaderous materials men's suit wearing. If you rent more than four times a year, it just makes sense to buy. Is there anyone else here that is lice free? [Phyllis, Kevin, Darryl. and Nellie raise their hands] Excellent. Do you have your own hazmat suits?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Renters. Ok, I'm gonna need you to gather your belongings, retreat to the warehouse, conduct your business there until the infected have been deloused. Let's get going. I'm gonna stay here and fight. If you don't hear from me by lunch, call me. I might want lunch.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Alright, we're going down to my warehouse, that means we're playing by my rules. No messing with the baler and be cool in front of me and Val. We just broke up.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You got dumped?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, she ended things.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Breakups are the worst. The only thing that got me through mine are large amounts of shepard's pie and Brandy. The singer, not the drink.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Here man. [Kevin hands Daryll some chocolate] You need that more than me.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Thanks, man.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah [kisses Darryl on the cheek]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Guys, I think we should all ease up on Meredith. This has got to be hard for her.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, no no no no no. I have not yet begun to shame.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: That's it. I'm getting my stuff. I'm leaving for the day.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No! Stanley! If you leave now then you'll get it in your car and then you'll get it in your house! [Erin jumps on Stanley's back]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Get off me!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm trying to save you from yourself!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Alright, I'll stay! There's a pencil broken in my rolls.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe it was Meredith. Maybe she brought in lice that are totally different than the lice that i got from Cece. So let's not jump to the simplest conclusion that she got her lice from me. That is how wars get started. Fine, I'll tell her it was me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh man, that's fresh squeezed. And, uh are all the snacks complimentary?

quotes.speaker: Limo Driver
quotes.text: Yeah, take some home if you want.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh no, no, no. That's ok. [Jim shoves some snacks in his pocket as he gets out of limo] Um I'm sorry, is this the conference center?

quotes.speaker: Limo Driver
quotes.text: No, Mr. Irving called. Said he'd rather meet you at his private court.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You gotta be kidding me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Meredith I need to tell you something.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [shaving her own head] Yes, Pam what do you want?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God, Meredith what are you doing!?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Baking a cake, what does it look like I'm doing? Getting rid of the lice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh stop! I am so sorry!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Oh, can you hold that thought? That's my wax. You know, I think these critters migrated from down south. What were you saying?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I am going to tell her, but now is clearly not the time.  I will buy her a wig, we'll have a few laughs. There's a right way to do this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Scalp leeches, skull vampires, follicle gypsies, hair lawyers. One thing is clear, it's kill or be killed!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No, no. It's more of a nuisance really. It's not that big a deal. So, I collected your hats and your coats...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: To be burned!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: To be washed.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What do we do about our heads?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm not gonna lie. Lye!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No, all we need is mayonnaise.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: She's right, it works. I would imagine.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes, it helps to suffrocate the little buddies and it's a really healthy alternative to the chemicals found in most lice shampoos.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I can appreciate that. I also only eat local, organic produce.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [walks in conference room] Shaboom! How do you like me now!?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Take a picture. It will last longer.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We don't want it to last longer. It's horrible.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Bald people make me sick.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah, everybody pile on Meredith. But I'm the only one with the balls to show them lice who's boss.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Ok, nobody panic. If everybody just follows my instructions, then nobody else needs to end up bald. Not that it looks bad, Meredith. It looks...It looks awesome. You look like a baby who suddenly aged 50 years. A cute baby, but something sucked the life force out of it. I'm so sorry. We need mayonnaise! We need it now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh! Uh, uh I'll go.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay. Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You're a saint, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no, it's not a big deal, please. No. Um, Meredith can I get you something special while I'm at the store, candy, or...or one of those stylish turbans?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Thanks Pam! I'll take a pack of Nicorette gum and a pack of Kools.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's talk pubes, people.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Hey, Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, hey Val.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, that was tragic, Oh, that was like a car crash. I couldn't look away. You two clearly still have feelings for each other.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What's gonna make you feel better, big guy?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: When I was a kid, my grandmother used to make me chocolate cake when I wasn't feeling good. She's not around to do that anymore. I'm sorry, I just need a moment to myself just to clear my head.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Aw, poor Darryl. I can't bear to see him suffer like this.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I think he needs some hugs, and maybe some chocolate cake.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Mmm, this won't help him, it's a muffin, not cake.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Listen, let's try and get Darryl the one thing in the world he clearly wants and needs the most.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: An Escalade.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Or what's her name.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Val.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Let's get Darryl Val.

quotes.speaker: Julius Irving
quotes.text: I hope you don't mind me bringing you out here. I can't get my knees under a desk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you kidding me? I can literally scalp tickets to this.

quotes.speaker: Julius
quotes.text: Well, do you think you can sink one from deep?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Listen, I don't mean to intimidate you, but I did play a little high school ball.

quotes.speaker: Julius
quotes.text: Okay. [Jim shoots the basket and it goes in] Wow, Halpert's got game.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright. [Jim's phone rings] Oh, sorry. I'm so sorry. It's my wife, can I take this?

quotes.speaker: Julius
quotes.text: It's your wife? You better take it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right! [Jim laughs as he answers the phone] Hey, what's up? Everything ok?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, no everything's great! Um, I was just calling to see how the meeting went.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's still happening right now actually, so uh...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He's really making you work for it, huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, it is very stressful. You sure everything's okay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great. I am killing it over here. [drops mayonnaise on the ground] Jim, I gotta go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, bye. [Jim turns back to Julius] So sorry about that.

quotes.speaker: Julius
quotes.text: No problem. Hey Jim, what size do you wear, man? I got a pair of japanese Nikes with your name on them. What do you think?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I love it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [handing out mayonnaise jars] Once it's all over your head, just leavr it there for four hours. That will be enough time for the lice to fall asleep, suffrocate, and then pass away.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh sure, and when you're ready to get serious, come to me to get it done right. [Dwight holds up a pair of scissors]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Put those away before you hurt yourself.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [swings the scissors around and puts them into his pocket, putting a hole in his Hazmat suit] Oh God, oh no. No. No. No! No! No! No! No!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay, it's easier with a buddy, so everybody pair up.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oscar, do you want to be my partner?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah, sure. I'd love to..

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hey, uh, mayo buddy, five dollar tip, you unclog my ears. Okay?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, Creed, I'm so sorry. I'm...I'm already partners with Pete, right Pete?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Uh, yeah. We promised each other if we ever got lice, we'd buddy up. Sorry, man.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Creed, wanna be my buddy?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Oh God. Stuck with the weirdo.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [Angela is slapping mayo on Oscar's head] Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You don't want bugs. You know? Who knows where those bugs will end up?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [putting mayo on Stanley's head] You're getting a bargain. I ain't got no hair no more.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [putting mayo on Creed's head] Creed, I'm all done. My turn.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I'm sorry, Pam. It looks a little messy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, wait.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: [putting mayo on Erin's head] How's that?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I feel it working. [Erin and Pete playing around with the mayo] Eiffel tower!

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Can I help you?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well, we don't want to pry but we heard you broke up with Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Yeah, that's true.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: We think you made a big, big mistake.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Big mistake.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Quite enormous.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: He's a real catch and you should take him back.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Ok, thank you. Is that all?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: No. No, that is not all. Let me tell you what real life is like. The men dry up, and the nights get lonely. The only calls on your machine are for collection agencies about that pair of motorcycle boots you never even wore. You stalk your old high school boyfriend online, go to his daughter's soccer games, and make a scene. You buy a diamond ring for yourself, wear it on your right hand, and tell yourself, you're all you need. One day, you're alone, tired. At your feet, a dying bird. But where did it come from? Why did you kill it? Is it because in some strange way it is you?

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Thank you all for your concern, but I'm gonna have to ask you to leave, okay?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So does this mean you're gonna take Darryl back?

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, then, what do you say to you and me hitting the town? 'Cause I'm free, literally forever.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Yeah, Kevin asked me out. I was kinda feeling good about reentering the dating pool, but then Kevin asked me out. Thought I might trade up to a new level of man. Then Kevin asked me out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [phone rings]  Hello?

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: [on speaker phone] Hi, honey, it's mom. Look, Cece's school just called. She still has lice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What, no. That can't...I don't...

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Now, don't worry, don't worry. I'm on my way to pick her up, but you might have lice too. You know, lice can be tricky. Sometimes lice, like...[Pam hangs up phone]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Shave her head. Shave her head!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [everyone yelling at Pam]You guys, I am so sorry! It's just been so chaotic with Jim gone, that...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yeah yeah, Princess Fancypants let Jane 12-pack over here take the fall.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [talking through the loud speaker] She's right Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is there a volume knob on that thing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah there's a volume knob on that thing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Meredith, I am so sorry.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, a lot of good your sorrys are doing her now, Pam. She's a monster.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I meant to say something earlier. I just...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Just? Just what? Just forgot?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Who's the one who didn't bring lice into the office? Meredith. Sure I gave everybody pink eye once, and my ex keyed a few of their cars, and yeah I BMed in the shredder on New Years. But I didn't bring the lice in. That was all Pam.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Attention, people of the office. You have exactly 60 secondes to evacutate the bull pen. At that time, I will be tossing this powerful insecticidal grenade, which contains piperonyl butoxide, as well as...[Dwight drops the grenade and it goes off inside Andy's office]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Dwight, are you okay!?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whoa. Hypertoxide has a mild hallucigenic effect, but I don't think it's kicked in yet. I'm gonna count down from ten. Nine, yellow, cold, sad, purple. [Dwight collapses]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Wow. He got to purple.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [Angela rinsing Oscar's hair, and she bumps his head] Ow!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You're waterboarding me!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oops.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [shoving large amounts of bubble wrap into the baler, as a warehouse worker passes]  No, this is fine. We are allowed to do this. This is okay.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You're up.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm kinda sad to see this baby go.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You do kinda look like Elvis, but we should probably wash all the dead lice out.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay. Okay. [rinsing Pete's hair out] Is that too cold?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: No, it actually  feels kinda nice.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I wonder what happened over there. I've been sitting here the whole time. [as the baler crushes the bubble wrap, making loud noises]

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Huh?

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Let's give it a shot. Let's make it work.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, no. I mean, I want to, I just...I don't want to force you into something you don't want to do.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: You're not. I believe in us.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: But... [Val kisses Darryl]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'm back together with Val. Yay...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I had a pretty good day today. Not everything went exactly according to plan, but lice if you are watching, I am ready for you anytime, anywhere. [Dwight gets into his car and another insecticidal grenade goes off]

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Hey, did Erin already take off?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I guess so.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Julius
quotes.text: You're Kareem, coming to help.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, I'm Kareem. That makes total sense. I'm Kareem. You're Dr. J. Just sounds weird to say out loud.

quotes.speaker: Julius
quotes.text: And it went like this. [Jim's phone starts ringing]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And that's all?

quotes.speaker: Julius
quotes.text: That's it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No one will believe this back home, but that's okay. Let me show you how it's done.

quotes.speaker: Julius
quotes.text: Yeah, you show me how.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Jim's phone goes to voicemail] This is Jim Halpert, leave a message.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey honey, it's me. Just trying to catch you before going home. Um, oh, well just give me a call whenever. Hope your day got better. Love you.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, what you doing right now?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm just gonna go home. My mom's been watching the kids all day.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Let her stay another hour. Let's go get a beer.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really? A beer sounds incredible right now.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: No duh. Let's go. You're buying.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Meredith, I am so sorry about today.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Forget about it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just did not realize how hard it was gonna be without Jim. I mean, I really respect you for being a single mom all these years. It whipped my ass in half a week. I have to say, there are not a lot of people who could pull off a shaved head, but you are rocking it.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Right. I got the bartender's phone number when you were in the john. I'm gonna take that freak to bone town before the night is over.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Get it, girl!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Pam and Meredith singing karaoke] This one's for all you ladies out there.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [starts singing] I come...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Not yet.

quotes.speaker: Both
quotes.text: [singing] I come home in the middle of the night. My mother says when you gonna live your life right? Oh Mother dear, we're not the fortunate ones. And girls, they want to have fun. Oh girls just want to have fun.
